TopicTitle: Can you roll back from 1.1.1 to 1.1?

Articles.Content:
If so how?

 

I am having a horrible time with rockets that use to work just fine are now jumping all over the place and falling apart. I even tried starting a new game and the nothing is behaving right with respect to rocket handling.
If you're on Steam, right click the KSP entry, go to properties, Betas and then chose "last stable release" from the drop down.
I'm not on stream. Any other suggestions? I tried to go to the KSP site under my account and download it but the only thing there is 1.1.1
You trashed the 1.1 DL? I always  keep a copy of the last version around, just in case.

3 minutes ago, tater said:

You trashed the 1.1 DL? I always  keep a copy of the last version around, just in case.

I used the launcher and it just ran the upgrade.... Does it save it as a download locally somewhere before upgrading the prior version? And why is there an option to DL 1.1.1 on the website and 1.05 but not prior versions?

Edited April 29, 2016 by Brian444444

HEH, seems like I might find myself with similar problem.  1.1.0 was running alright on my box, but steam quietly updated it to 1.1.1 before I got the chance to back up 1.1.0.  Is it possible to snag the previous non-beta version?

7 hours ago, djnattyd said:

If you're on Steam, right click the KSP entry, go to properties, Betas and then chose "last stable release" from the drop down.

It goes back to 1.0.5
